ratings.comment: Lectures for InterEGR 160 were extremely boring and were pretty much worthless and are 'mandatory'. Weekly quizzes were easy and answers could be found on lecture slides posted on moodle. Make sure to not use your phone or laptop during lecture because he will come up to you and close your laptop or tell you to get off your phone.

Murphy is a really cool guy. He is very funny in a dry sort of way. His Survey of Nuclear Class is very interesting, and as a non Nuclear Engineering major I learned a lot. It is a very easy way to fill in 1 credit. There is no work for the entire semester but one 10 page paper, and there are no exams. Definitely recommend!
One of the most boring lectures one could possibly sit through. The lectures don't even effect your grade.

John Murphy gave a few lectures, but mainly brought in other guest speakers to talk.  He was a fine lecturer.  The class really depends on the project, and has little to do with John Murphy.  Enthusiastic about engineering!

Murphy really doesn't speak much in lecture, as he brings in many guest speakers. Some of these guests are very interesting, others are boring. The class more depends on who you have as your lab professor. I do recommend 160 as you get a lot out of it and it is an easy A.
Overall, I liked John. He did not speak too much, but when he did I enjoyed listing to him and learned a lot from what he had to said. All of the guest speakers he invited were very insightful.
Pretty nice guy. You have to go to lectures for your grade but overal it's worth it, they are interesting. He doesn't do much teaching because of guest speakers but overall a good professor.

John doesn't do much himself, other than give a couple lectures and introduce his guest speakers. The class is helpful for determining which discipline of engineering you want to be. The lab portion of the class is the main part, and it is challenging, but very fun and rewarding. Definitely recommend this class.

Attendance is mandatory. Had guest speakers for half of his lectures, but when he did speak he seemed a bit stuck up and he was annoying to listen to. He was very clear about what he expected of his students, though.

Great teacher. Doesn't teach directly out of the book which makes for interesting lectures. Brings in great guest speakers for a variety of topics. Homework is fairly simple being that he emails out hints for each problem set. Highly recommend taking this course with him.
John Murphy's class has different professors lecture about certain topics. The only bad thing about him is that he asks a lot of questions to the presenter so that we can't leave class early.

He has guest speakers most of the time so you really only listen to him a half dozen or so times during the semester. He was pretty interesting and the homework wasn't bad as long as you actually showed up. All of his guest speakers knew what they were talking about and most were interesting(ish). overall I recommend Murphy and EGR 160

Had Murphy for the lecture and the lab section of the 160 class. He had guest speakers for the majority of his lectures and I would see him sleeping through almost all of them. In lab he was just as unhelpful and expected too much of us.
One of my favorite Professors, he knows his stuff.

John doesn't mess around.  Insists on attendance in lecture and lab.  Expects students to act as adults; grown up, mature, professional.  Does not like excuses of any sort.  Half of your grade depends on your peers, so good working relationships with your group are a must.  Class is easy to get an A in.
Good guy, until he decided to give us all poor grades for no reason. I guess helping with every project, attending every lecture, and participating only deserves a B. Don't piss this guy off..
Awesome man.  He is all-knowing and a great help at virtually anything
Nice, forgiving and clear, knows his stuff, has real world knowledge
No Comments

John is a great man and is infinitely helpful.  He is an expert in many fields of engineering and has good advise for any situation.  He does get mad if you skip lecture though, so go to lecture frequently in order to stay on his good side.
No Comments
